dilettante: Person who takes up an art or activity for amusement only or in a superficial way
discordant: Harsh or inharmonious in sound; disagreeing, incongruous
dissemble: Mislead, conceal the truth, put on a false appearance of
dilate: To become wider or make wider, cause to expand; to speak or write at length, elaborate upon
disparage: Belittle, put down; bring shame upon, discredit
dilatory: Slow, late; procrastinating or stalling for time
dirge: A funeral or mourning song or poem
discrete: Separate, distinct, detached, existing as individual parts
